p: Mikania micrantha H.B.K. is a rapidly-growing perennial creeping vine belonging to the family Asteraceae native to Central and South America [ 22]. The vine has been listed among the top 100 worst invasive species [ 22, 23] and as one of the top 10 worst weeds in the world [ 22]. M. micrantha is present in tropical Asia, parts of Papua New Guinea, Indian Ocean islands, Pacific Ocean Islands, and Florida in the US [ 22, 24, 25]. It has colonized a broad range of farming systems and forest lands, banks of streams and rivers, roadsides and railway tracks, pastures, and open disturbed areas [ 22], leading to serious economic loss, biodiversity loss and negative environmental impacts [ 7, 18, 22, 26, 27].
